intro: Erigeron allochrous, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and daisy-like, with white ray florets surrounding yellow disk florets. Erigeron allochrous is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
